verses.roman:
eta bali' vandilā haridāsera caraṇa
haridāsa kahe,--"kara kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtana"

synonyms: eta bali'-saying this; vandilā—worshiped; haridāsera caraṇa—the lotus feet of Haridāsa Ṭhākura; haridāsa kahe—Haridāsa said; kara—just perform; kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtana—chanting of the holy name of Kṛṣṇa.
translation: After speaking in this way, Māyā worshiped the lotus feet of Haridāsa Ṭhākura, who initiated her by saying,"Just perform chanting of the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra."

purport.content: Now even Māyā wanted to be favored by Haridāsa Ṭhākura. Therefore Haridāsa Ṭhākura formally initiated her by asking her to chant the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra.
